ripple.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to move in small waves, or to make something move in this way
ripple.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: fields of grain rippling in the soft wind
I could see the muscles rippling under his shirt.
ripple.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to pass from one person to another like a wave
ripple.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Panic rippled through Hollywood as the murders were discovered.
Enthusiastic applause rippled around the tables.
ripple.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if a feeling ripples through you, you feel it strongly
ripple.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Anger was rippling through him so fiercely that his whole body shook.
ripple.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to make a noise like water that is flowing gently
ripple.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The water rippled over the stones.
ripple.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a small low wave on the surface of a liquid
ripple.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: ripples on the surface of the pond
She dived into the pool, making scarcely a ripple.
ripple.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a sound that gets gradually louder and softer
ripple.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: A ripple of laughter ran through the audience.
ripple.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a feeling that spreads through a person or a group because of something that has happened
ripple.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: A ripple of excitement went through the crowd as he came on stage.
ripple.translation[1].definitions[3].def: a shape or pattern that looks like a wave
